Reaper’s Revenge.name: Reaper’s Revenge
Reaper’s Revenge.description:
Potion, rare

When you drink this potion, you are filled with intense and violent vigor, gaining [[/damage 3d8 temp]]. For 1 minute, when one of your enemies dies within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to regain [[/damage 1d8 healing]]{1d8 hit points}.

The base of this glass potion bottle is shaped like a skull, and the images of scythes run up its neck.

Heightened Potency. For 1 minute after drinking this potion, when you hit a creature that has half its hit points or fewer with an attack roll and deal damage to it, the creature takes an extra [[/damage 1d8 necrotic]] damage.

Cane of Phillip Druskenvald.name: Cane of Phillip Druskenvald
Cane of Phillip Druskenvald.description:
Rod, Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This ornate cane is made from polished black wood and is topped with a silver goat-skull ornament. Even a glance at it sparks greed and envy in all but the truly humble.

While holding the cane, you can use it as a Spellcasting Focus for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the cane’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Eldritch Glutton (Rare+). When you succeed on a saving throw against a spell that targets only you, you can take a Reaction to consume the spell and store its energy in the cane. The spell has no effect on you. You can take a Magic action to absorb the stored energy to either regain an expended spell slot that is at least one level lower than the triggering spell or gain Temporary Hit Points equal to three times the spell’s level. If you absorb a new spell while the cane holds spell energy, the previous energy is lost. Once the cane absorbs a spell, this property can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Allure of Sin (Very Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.91Sw6vOIaO7U8DvM]{Dominate Person} (save DC = 16 + the cane’s bonus) from the cane. Once a creature is Charmed by the spell, this property can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sin-Binder’s Call (Legendary). As a Magic action, you can summon three @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.iSCL4Q82ivnYelzc]{Hell Hounds}, one @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.VmdyZDjqAc8vdncY]{Incubus}, or one @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.VmdyZDjqAc8vdncY]{Succubus}. They appear in unoccupied spaces you can see within 30 feet of you, obey your commands, and take their turns immediately after yours on your Initiative count. After 10 minutes, they no longer obey you, but if you treated them well, they are Indifferent or Friendly toward you. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Marotte of the Lord of Fools.name: Marotte of the Lord of Fools
Marotte of the Lord of Fools.description:
Rod, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This wooden fool’s scepter is painted with vibrant, unsettling colors that depict a grinning face. While no creature is attuned to the marotte, the face looks like the infamous Chuckles, the Lord of Fools.

While holding the marotte, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the marotte’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Coulrophobia (Rare+). When you succeed on a saving throw to avoid being &reference[frightened apply=false], you can use your reaction to force the creature that created the effect to make the same saving throw. On a failed save, it becomes frightened until the end of your next turn.

Fortune’s Fool (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.BQk5Row4NymMnUQl]{Hideous Laughter} (save DC = 16 + the marotte’s bonus) from the marotte. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk. You regain use of the spell early if you roll a 1 on the [[/r d20]] for an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw.

Fool’s Motley (Very Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7e3QXF10hLNDEdr6]{False Life} from the marotte. Any clothing or armor you wear looks like a fool’s motley for the duration of the spell.

Slapstick (Very Rare+). When a creature is affected by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.BQk5Row4NymMnUQl]{Hideous Laughter} spell you cast, you can choose another creature. When that creature deals damage to the target of the spell, the target has disadvantage rather than advantage on its saving throw to end the spell.

Lord of Fools (Legendary). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.5OGFdJw35QXp6mh6]{Mass Suggestion} (save DC 19) from the marotte. The effect ends on a creature if it is behind total cover or more than 120 feet from you. A creature affected by your Hideous Laughter automatically fails its saving throw against this Mass Suggestion. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Marotte of the Lord of Fools +2.name: Marotte of the Lord of Fools +2

Marotte of the Lord of Fools +3.name: Marotte of the Lord of Fools +3
Marotte of the Lord of Fools +3

Marotte of the Lord of Fools +2.name: Marotte of the Lord of Fools +2

Marotte of the Lord of Fools +1.name: Marotte of the Lord of Fools +1

Sword of the Crimson Abbot.name: Sword of the Crimson Abbot
Sword of the Crimson Abbot.description:
Weapon (Longsword), Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This powerful, fiendish sword was once wielded by the Crimson Abbot. While it was created as a gift that brought evil and malice to the corrupted former knight, it has lost its connections to the Crimson Rose. However, its evil origins still linger within. The sword is sleek and polished, with a blade that absorbs light. A blood-red ruby on the hilt is fitted within a setting of thorns and roses.

You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by the sword’s rarity. While holding the sword, you can use the following properties.

Blood Drain (Rare+). When you hit a creature with the sword, it takes an extra [[/damage 1d6 Necrotic]] damage.

Irresistible Hunger (Very Rare+). Necrotic damage you deal ignores Resistance.

Vampiric Charm (Very Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.eS7XnnApoxRxYXPs]{Charm Person} (save DC = 16 + the sword’s bonus, no Concentration required) from the sword. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Embrace of the Duchess (Legendary). As a Magic action, you can touch the sword to the body of a Humanoid that has been dead for 1 minute or less. The creature must succeed on a [[/save CHA DC 19]] saving throw (as if it were alive) or become a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.zpaZb7I8alY32vWV]{Vampire Spawn} that dies again at dawn. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Stolen Life (Legendary). When you deal Necrotic damage with the Blood Drain property, you can expend and roll one Hit Point Die. You regain Hit Points equal to the number rolled plus the Necrotic damage dealt.

The Bag.name: The Bag
The Bag.description:
Wondrous Item, Very Rare (Requires Attunement)

This weathered old satchel has three tarnished silver buckles that hold it shut. There are faint bloodstains on the inside of the flap, and the bag occasionally ripples as if something inside is moving. The bag functions as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.aDHRuUs29SrumWfq]{Bag of Holding} and has the following additional properties.

Inhabitant. A Lurker in the Dark* lives in the bag’s extradimensional space. If reduced to 0 Hit Points, the lurker vanishes and reappears in the bag at the next midnight. The lurker only dies if it is reduced to 0 Hit Points by a creature holding a toy or stuffed animal once owned by a child. If the lurker is killed, the bag loses its magic, and anything in it appears in unoccupied spaces closest to the bag.

The Bag’s Claw. While holding the bag, you can take a Bonus Action to have the lurker in the dark lash out with its claw at a creature within 5 feet of you. Make a melee attack roll with a +7 bonus. On a hit, the claw deals [[/damage 1d10 + 4 Piercing]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 14) from the claw, and it has the &reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

Lurker’s Curse. When you finish a Long Rest, roll [[/r 1d6]]. On a 1, the lurker slipped out of the bag during the rest and caused mayhem in a nearby area, such as attacking people, causing livestock to sicken, or spoiling provisions.

Jinxed Rum.name: Jinxed Rum
Jinxed Rum.description:
Potion, Uncommon

When you drink this brightly colored rum, your luck takes a strange turn for 1 hour. For the duration, when you make a D20 Test, roll [[/r 1d4]]. On a 2–4, add the number to your roll. On a 1, roll an extra [[/r d20]] and use the lowest roll for the test.

This potion is stored in a glass rum bottle marked with crossbones.

Heightened Potency. Roll [[/r 1d6]] instead of 1d4.

Planchette of Adela Druskenvald.name: Planchette of Adela Druskenvald
Planchette of Adela Druskenvald.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

A small, heart-shaped silver pointer hangs from a silver necklace. It is inscribed with occult symbols. When placed on an open book or other assortment of letters, the air nearby feels heavy and cold.

While wearing the planchette, you can use it as a Spellcasting Focus for your spells, you gain a bonus to Intelligence and Wisdom ability checks determined by the planchette’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Sense the Unseen (Rare+). The planchette has 5 charges and regains [[/r 1d4 + 1]] expended charges daily at dusk. You can expend charges to cast the following spells from it: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8]{Detect Magic} (1 charge), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.SleYkHovQ8NagmeV]{Locate Object} (2 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.DQzlB5Y3k791W5bH]{See Invisibility} (2 charges).

Starlight Ward (Rare+). You have Resistance to &reference[Radiant apply=false] damage. When you take Radiant damage, for the next minute, the star-sigils on the planchette shed Bright Light in a 10-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 10 feet.

Vision Beyond (Very Rare+). TThe planchette now has 9 charges and regains [[/r 1d8 + 1]] expended charges daily at dusk. You can also cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.KrM3oHVv13RAALrS]{Find Traps} (2 charges) and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.GtGjNjPBgUHxGYAD]{Sending} (3 charges) from it.

Spirit Ward (Very Rare+). When you fail a saving throw against the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ej6wyY4G1gOcb1U6]{Magic Jar} spell or possession (such as by a ghost), you can expend 3 charges to succeed instead.

Third Eye Opened (Legendary). The planchette now has 13 charges and regains [[/r 1d12 + 1]] expended charges daily at dusk. You can also cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XqzXSKNR75ZdYTA9]{Divination} (4 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.dSTu1MaPhBqPITwM]{Contact Other Plane} (5 charges), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsterfeatures.Item.rDoNJnKdY47x8MD4]{Etherealness} (7 charges) from it.

Green Ribbon.name: Green Ribbon
Green Ribbon.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

This green satin ribbon is just long enough to fasten around a person’s neck comfortably. It’s hard to think why you’d even want to remove it. While you wear the ribbon, you have a +5 bonus to Death Saving Throws, and it grants the following properties.

Instant Attunement. If the ribbon is wrapped around the neck of a dead creature that has been dead no longer than 10 days and wasn’t Undead when it died, the creature returns to life as if by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.AGFMPAmuzwWO6Dfz]{Raise Dead} spell, and it instantly attunes to the ribbon. The creature dies immediately if its Attunement to the ribbon ends or if the ribbon is removed.

Ribbon’s Mending. When you drop to 0 Hit Points, you can take a Reaction to immediately regain Hit Points equal to half your level (minimum 1). Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk or until you roll a 20 on the d20 for a Death Saving Throw.

Curse of the Ribbon. Creatures other than you within 60 feet of you have a −1 penalty to Death Saving Throws. This penalty increases by 1 each time you use the Ribbon’s Mending property.

Midwife Shears.name: Midwife Shears
Midwife Shears.description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

These scissors are shaped to resemble a stork. Their blades are forever wickedly sharp, and the threads they cut are more than merely physical.

Cut the Unseen Thread. While holding the scissors, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8]{Dispel Magic} (+4 bonus) or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XZhdgVK3cLoxNCQl]{Remove Curse} from them. Once either spell is cast from the scissors, that spell can’t be cast from them again until the next dusk.

Curse of the Severed Thread. When you make a saving throw to avoid being pushed or to avoid being knocked prone, you have a −1 penalty to the roll. This penalty increases by 1 each time you use the Cut the Unseen Thread property. If you fail such a save by 5 or more, you are pushed 1d6 x 5 feet straight away from the source of the save, in addition to any other distance pushed.

Cut the Unseen Thread - Dispel Magic.name: Cut the Unseen Thread - Dispel Magic

Cut the Unseen Thread - Remove Curse.name: Cut the Unseen Thread - Remove Curse

Harvest Brew.name: Harvest Brew
Harvest Brew.description:
Potion, Rare

When you drink this potion, you are filled with good health and bounty, providing you with enough nourishment to sustain you for 1 day. For the next hour, when you regain Hit Points, you regain additional Hit Points equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

The potion’s bottle is made from a hollowed-out gourd, and the thick, liquid inside is a deep orange that tastes of nutmeg and cardamom.

Heightened Potency. The additional Hit Points you regain are equal to half your level rather than your Proficiency Bonus (minimum +2).

Haint Hooch.name: Haint Hooch
Haint Hooch.description:
Potion, Rare

When you drink from this glass jug, you become insubstantial for 1 minute. During this time, you can move through creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain, taking [[/damage 1d10 Force]] damage if you end your turn inside an object.

The potion is stored in jugs labeled “XxX,” with a skeletal smile drawn on it. The ghastly, blue-green liquor within has an overpowering smell and harsh taste.

Heightened Potency. For the duration, you gain a Fly Speed equal to your Speed.

Chunk of Oozing Fungus.name: Chunk of Oozing Fungus
Chunk of Oozing Fungus.description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

This fist-sized fungal growth is a pallid color, is oozy and lumpy, and frequently fills the air with spores. The fungus has the following properties.

Spore Cloud. As an action, you can throw the fungus up to 30 feet. The fungus is destroyed and explodes into a cloud of spores in a 30-foot sphere centered on that point. Each creature other than you in the area must make a [[/save CON DC 14]] saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes [[/damage 3d8 poison]] damage and is &reference[poisoned apply=false] until the start of your next turn. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more becomes incapacitated. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage only.

Regrow. You can grow another Chunk of Oozing Fungus by coughing green-black spores into your hand as a bonus action. When you do so, you must succeed on a [[/save CON DC 10]] saving throw or your hit point maximum decreases by 5. This reduction lasts until you finish a long rest.

Fungal Curse. You have a −1 penalty to Constitution saving throws. This penalty increases by 1 immediately after you succeed or fail on the saving throw from the Regrow property.

Runestone of the Wild Titan.name: Runestone of the Wild Titan
Runestone of the Wild Titan.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This mighty granite runestone is etched with complex glyphs on much of its angular surface. Though an incredible burden to carry, it thrums with the power of the wild titan. The stone weighs 50 pounds.

While holding the stone, you gain a bonus to Strength and Constitution saving throws determined by the runestone’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Crushing Weight (Rare+). When you are within 5 feet of a creature with the Prone condition, you can take a Bonus Action to set the stone on the creature to give it the &reference[Restrained apply=false] condition. The creature can take an action to make a Strength saving throw (DC = 16 + the stone's bonus), pushing the stone free and ending the Restrained condition on a success.

Boulder Throw (Very Rare+). You can throw the stone as a Simple Ranged weapon using Strength for the attack and damage rolls. The stone has the Heavy and Thrown properties. It has a normal range equal to twice your Strength score and a long range equal to five times your Strength score. On a hit, it deals [[/damage 2d10 Bludgeoning]] damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC = 16 + the stone’s bonus) or have the Prone condition.

Recall (Very Rare+). As a Bonus Action, you can call the stone back to you, provided it is within 1 mile. If you have an empty hand, it appears in your hand; otherwise, it appears at your feet in your space.

Primal Vitality (Legendary). While you stand on fertile soil or unworked stone, you have Advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws, and you gain Temporary Hit Points equal to [[/r 2d6]] + your Strength modifier at the start of each of your turns.

Pummeling Boulder (Legendary). The damage of the Boulder Throw property increases to [[/r 3d10]], and the stone deals double damage to objects and structures.

CKdyiDwZjcvKwuUf.name: Jinxed Rum
CKdyiDwZjcvKwuUf.description:
Potion, uncommon

When you drink this brightly colored rum, your luck takes a strange turn for 1 hour. For the duration, when you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, roll [[/r 1d4]]. On a 2–4, add the number to your roll. On a 1, roll an extra [[/r d20]] and use the lowest roll instead.

This potion is stored in a glass rum bottle marked with crossbones.

Heightened Potency. Roll [[/r 1d6]] instead of 1d4.

Black Candle.name: Black Candle
Black Candle.description:
Wondrous item, very rare (requires attunement)

This broad, black tallow candle is engraved with arcane symbols. When lit, its smoke is greasy and pungent, and its flame is pale gray, but it never burns down. The candle has the following properties.

Word of Flame and Darkness. As a bonus action, you can light or extinguish the candle by speaking a command word while within 60 feet of it. It sheds dim light in a 30-foot radius.

Witchlight. While you are in the candle’s light, you can cast a level 1 or 2 spell without expending a spell slot. When you cast a spell in this way, you can’t cast that spell using the candle again for 24 hours, and you must succeed on a DC 0 Constitution saving throw or take fire damage equal to [[/roll 2d6]] times the spell’s level.

Cursed Candle. After you succeed or fail on the saving throw of the Witchlight property, its save DC increases by 2. This increase can’t happen again until you finish a long rest. When the DC is 10 or higher, you also have vulnerability to necrotic damage.

Shield of Marius Renathyr.name: Shield of Marius Renathyr
Shield of Marius Renathyr.description:
Armor (Shield), Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

Crafted from polished gold and white enamel and adorned with an intricate design of a rose encircled by thorny vines, this Shield was once owned by Marius Renathyr, a knight-errant destined for a terrible fate.

While holding this Shield, you gain a bonus to AC determined by the Shield’s rarity, in addition to the Shield’s normal bonus to AC, and you can use the following properties.

Valorous Guard (Rare+). When a creature within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can take a Reaction to add 2 + the Shield’s bonus to the creature’s AC, potentially causing the attack to miss. When a creature within 5 feet of you fails a Dexterity saving throw, you can take a Reaction to add 2 + the Shield’s bonus to the creature’s total, potentially causing it to succeed.

Honor of the Vanguard (Very Rare+). When you roll Initiative and an ally you can see is within 30 feet of an enemy, you can teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of that ally and gain Temporary Hit Points equal to 5 times the Shield’s bonus.

Righteous Wrath (Very Rare+). When you use the Valorous Guard property to cause an attack to miss, the next time you hit that attacker with a weapon or Unarmed Strike before the end of your next turn, it takes an extra [[/r 1d8]] (Legendary: [[/r 3d8]]) Radiant damage.

As Terrible as the Dawn (Legendary). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.5e1xTohkzqFqbYH4]{Flame Strike} (save DC 19) from the Shield. If you are in the spell’s area, you regain [[/damage 5d6 healing]]{5d6 Hit Points} instead of taking damage. Once the spell is cast from the Shield, it can’t be cast from it again until the next dusk.

As Terrible as the Dawn (Legendary) Heal.name: As Terrible as the Dawn (Legendary) Heal

Hypnovulfen Figure.name: Hypnovulfen Figure
Hypnovulfen Figure.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

This carved wooden figurine depicts a crooked wolf with large, leering eyes and a wild, toothy maw. While holding the figure, you can use it as a Spellcasting Focus, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs. The figure has the following properties.

Hypnovulfen Bite. Your teeth become viciously sharp. You can bite as an Unarmed Strike that deals 1d6 Piercing damage instead of Bludgeoning damage.

Hypnovulfen Eye. While holding the figure, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.9hQXdMSmerkTsHDe]{Confusion} (save DC 14) with it. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Cursed Hunger. When you roll Initiative, you must succeed on a DC 0 Wisdom saving throw or you can’t use the Attack or Magic actions except to use the figure’s properties until you hit a creature with a Hypnovulfen Bite attack. When you use the Hypnovulfen Eye property, the DC of this saving throw increases by 2.

Hook of the Tall Man.name: Hook of the Tall Man
Hook of the Tall Man.description:
Weapon (War Pick), Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This hook is made from a single huge claw attached to a large bleached fingerbone mounted on a haft of ash. The tip of the claw gives off an eerie glow. The finger and claw were cut from the hand of the Tall Man.

You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by the hook’s rarity. While holding the hook, you can use the following properties.

Snare (Rare+). When you hit a creature with the hook, you can activate the Topple mastery property in addition to a different mastery property you’re using with it.

Fey Haunt’s Stride (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.wqfAVANuQonNBgnL]{Misty Step} from the hook, and when you do so, you have Advantage on your next Dexterity (Stealth) check made before the end of your next turn. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses when you roll Initiative.

Strike from Shadows (Very Rare+). When you start your turn with the Invisible condition, you have Advantage on the first attack you make on your turn, even if the condition ends before you make the attack. If that attack hits, it deals an extra [[/damage 2d6 Piercing]] damage.

Hunter’s Hook (Legendary). When you hit with an Opportunity Attack made with the hook, the target takes an extra [[/damage 2d6 Psychic]] damage, and its Speed is 0 until the end of the turn.

Terrifying Stride (Legendary). Immediately after you use the Fey Haunt’s Stride property, you can choose a creature within 20 feet of you. It must succeed on a [[/save WIS DC 19]] saving throw or have the &reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of your next turn. While Frightened in this way, the creature can’t take the Disengage action.

Cutlass of Briggsy Kratch.name: Cutlass of Briggsy Kratch
Cutlass of Briggsy Kratch.description:
Weapon (Scimitar), Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

A fearsome weapon imbued with jinxcraft magic, this cutlass was once wielded by the notorious pirate captain, Briggsy “The Kutlass” Kratch. Its tarnished blade glimmers with a faint, otherworldly light. A skull and crossbones adorn the leather-wrapped hilt, and arcane symbols etched into the blade pulse with hidden power.

You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with the cutlass determined by its rarity. While holding the cutlass, you can use the following properties.

Raise the Stakes (Rare+). As a Bonus Action, choose a creature within 5 feet of you and mark it until the start of your next turn. Count the number of times you hit the target and the number of times it hits you while the mark lasts. If you hit the target more times, it takes [[/damage 2d10 Psychic]] damage. If it hits you more times, you take [[/damage 2d10 Psychic]] damage. If your hits are tied, you both take [[/damage 2d10 Psychic]] damage. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sea Legs (Rare+). When you take the Disengage action, Difficult Terrain doesn’t cost you extra movement until the end of that turn.

Double Down (Very Rare+). When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can make one additional attack against a target marked by the Raise the Stakes property.

Jinxcraft Panache (Very Rare+). When a creature hits you with an attack roll, you can take a Reaction to increase your AC against that attack by twice the cutlass’s bonus to attack and damage rolls if the creature already dealt damage to you on this turn.

Hex Ward (Legendary). You can’t be targeted with Divination spells or perceived through magical scrying sensors, and a creature that curses you takes Psychic damage equal to your level.

Lilypad Tonic.name: Lilypad Tonic
Lilypad Tonic.description:
Potion, common

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.04nMsTWkIFvkbXlY]{Polymorph} spell (no concentration required), turning you into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.EZgiprHXA2D7Uyb3]{Frog}.

This potion is found in a clay jar shaped and painted like a large frog, with a cork stopper in its back.

Heightened Potency. The potion has six doses instead of one.

Amber Birdcage.name: Amber Birdcage
Amber Birdcage.description:
Wondrous item, very rare (requires attunement)

This birdcage, shaped from amber, physically replaces your torso while you are attuned to it. When your attunement ends, it separates from you, and your torso returns to its previous state. The birdcage has the following properties.

Sense Fiends. As a bonus action, you can sense the location of Fiends or magical effects created by Fiends within 60 feet of yourself.

Capture Fiend. As an action, choose one Fiend with half its hit points or fewer that you can see within 60 feet of yourself. It must succeed on a [[/save CHA DC 15]] saving throw or be transformed into an amber songbird and trapped in the birdcage. The songbird is an inert object until removed from the cage and released. You can remove one songbird from the cage as a bonus action. If you stop holding the bird, the Fiend reverts to its true form with all its hit points, and it is hostile to you.

Consume Songbird. As an action, you can consume one amber songbird you are holding. The Fiend dies, and you can either regain one expended spell slot with a level up to half the Fiend’s CR, or you can gain temporary hit points equal to the Fiend’s CR.

Amber Curse. You have a −1 penalty to Wisdom saving throws. Each time you use the Capture Fiend or Consume Songbird properties, this penalty increases by 1.

Devilbone Button.name: Devilbone Button
Devilbone Button.description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

This bone button is found on an article of clothing, such as a shirt or coat, and is carved with the tiny image of a devil. It must be attached to clothing that you wear to attune to it. You gain a +1 bonus to saving throws, and it has the following properties.

Improbable Luck. When you fail a saving throw while wearing the button, you can choose to succeed instead. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Protective Bone. While wearing the button, your hit point maximum increases by 5 + your Constitution modifier.

Diabolic Curse. When you finish a long rest, there is a 1 percent chance the button is mysteriously missing and your attunement to it ends. A devil with a CR of your level + 3 or CR 20 (whichever is lower) then becomes your enemy and seeks to destroy you. The GM determines the devil’s details. When you use the Improbable Luck property, the chance the button disappears increases by 1.

Bell of the Dusk Mother.name: Bell of the Dusk Mother
Bell of the Dusk Mother.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This heavy iron handbell is elaborately decorated with filigree. Its handle is a large ring, and its clapper hangs from a chain within. Its only sound is ever-mournful tolling.

While holding the bell, you can use it as a Spellcasting Focus for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by its rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Dolorous Tolling (Rare+). As a Magic action, you can ring the bell, producing an ominous tolling. Creatures of your choice in a 30-foot Emanation originating from you must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the bell’s bonus). On a failed save, a target takes 3d10 Psychic damage, and for 1 minute, when it makes an attack roll or saving throw, it must subtract [[/r 1d4]] from the total. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Call of the Bell (Very Rare+). You can take a Bonus Action to create a doll (use the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.eORmAXuV5v3nWsQL]{Animated Armor} stat block) from a 5-foot Cube of wood, clay, or stone within 10 feet. The doll obeys your commands and acts immediately after your turn on your Initiative. It reverts to the materials used to create it after 10 minutes or when it dies. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

Death Knell (Legendary). As a Magic action, you can ring the bell, creating a loud clang. Each Bloodied creature in a 30-foot Emanation originating from you must make a [[/save CON DC 19]] saving throw, taking [[/damage 5d10 Necrotic]] damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more drops to 0 Hit Points. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

GHEsXd1LBimCC1Lx.name: Devilbone Button
GHEsXd1LBimCC1Lx.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

This bone button is found on an article of clothing, such as a shirt or coat, and is carved with the tiny image of a devil. It must be attached to clothing that you wear to attune to it. You gain a +1 bonus to saving throws, and it has the following properties.

Improbable Luck. When you fail a saving throw while wearing the button, you can choose to succeed instead. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Protective Bone. While wearing the button, your Hit Point maximum increases by 5 + your Constitution modifier.

Diabolic Curse. When you finish a Long Rest, there is a 1 percent chance the button is mysteriously missing and your Attunement to it ends. A devil with a CR of your level + 3 or CR 20 (whichever is lower) then becomes your enemy and seeks to destroy you. The GM determines the devil’s details. When you use the Improbable Luck property, the chance the button disappears increases by 1.

Eye of the White Worm.name: Eye of the White Worm
Eye of the White Worm.description:
Wondrous item, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This fist-sized eyeball is cold and clammy to the touch. It is milky-white with purple veins, and its pupil constantly searches for something.

While holding the eye, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the eye’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Thought Scour (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er]{Detect Thoughts} (save DC = 16 + the eye’s bonus) from the eye. When you probe deeper into a creature’s mind, it takes [[/damage 3d8 psychic]] damage unless it is a willing target. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Mnemonic Siphon (Very Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.r3243JU4AyQJyfX4]{Modify Memory} (save DC = 16 + the eye’s bonus) from the eye. When you do, you gain a version of the affected memory as if you experienced it yourself, though you still know the memory isn’t yours. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Violation of the Real (Very Rare+). When you cast a conjuration spell using a spell slot that deals damage, or that summons a creature that can deal damage, the spell or creature deals an extra [[/damage 1d10 psychic]] damage to one target the first time it deals damage during a turn.

Enduring Violation (Legendary). When you cast a conjuration spell with a duration of 1 hour or more, you can extend the duration to 24 hours, and the spell no longer requires concentration. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Hide of the Brimstone Behemoth.name: Hide of the Brimstone Behemoth
Hide of the Brimstone Behemoth.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This cloak was made from the hide of a reptilian magma Fiend, incomparable in its destructive power. Flame now shies away from it, for one who has mastered such a titanic creature can master its element.

While wearing this cloak, you gain a bonus to Armor Class and Constitution saving throws determined by the cloak’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Deep-Dweller (Rare+). You have Resistance to &reference[Fire apply=false] damage and a Burrow Speed equal to your Speed. Once during your turn when you emerge from burrowing, each creature in a 10-foot Emanation originating from you must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 16 + the hide’s bonus), taking [[/damage 2d8 Fire]] damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Infernal Roar (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XXUDGFELgoskdOD0]{Fear} (save DC = 16 + the hide’s bonus) from the cloak. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

Hellfire Maw (Very Rare+). As a Magic action, you can exhale hellfire in a 30-foot Cone. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 16 + the hide’s bonus). On a failed save, a creature takes [[/damage 4d6 Fire]] damage and [[/damage 4d6 Necrotic]] damage, and it can’t regain Hit Points for 1 minute. On a successful save, it takes half damage only. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Pernicious Fire Immunity (Legendary). Fire actively avoids you. You have Immunity to &reference[Fire apply=false] damage. When you are the target of an attack that deals Fire damage, the attack randomly targets another creature within the attack’s range, which can include the attacker. When you make a saving throw against an effect that deals Fire damage, you must choose one other creature that is also making the saving throw against that effect. It has Disadvantage on the save.

IAKTIfQVP5O1tcvI.name: Eye of the White Worm
IAKTIfQVP5O1tcvI.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This fist-sized eyeball is cold and clammy to the touch. It is milky-white with purple veins, and its pupil constantly searches for something.

When you probe deeper into a creature’s mind, it takes [[/damage 3d8 Psychic]] damage unless it is a willing target. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Mnemonic Siphon (Very Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.r3243JU4AyQJyfX4]{Modify Memory} (save DC = 16 + the eye’s bonus) from the eye. When you do, you gain a version of the affected memory as if you experienced it yourself, though you still know the memory isn’t yours. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Violation of the Real (Very Rare+). When you cast a Conjuration spell using a spell slot that deals damage, or that summons a creature that can deal damage, the spell or creature deals an extra [[/damage 1d10 Psychic]] damage to one target the first time it deals damage during a turn.

Enduring Violation (Legendary). When you cast a Conjuration spell with a duration of 1 hour or more, you can extend the duration to 24 hours, and the spell no longer requires Concentration. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Lantern of the Chained Reaper.name: Lantern of the Chained Reaper
Lantern of the Chained Reaper.description:
Wondrous item, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This ornate hooded lantern was once a weapon in the hands of the Chained Reaper, filled with ghastly balefire. Able to pierce the veil, the lantern reveals a glimpse at things hidden from mortal eyes.

While you hold the lantern and it is lit, you gain a bonus to Intelligence (Investigation) and Wisdom (Perception) checks determined by the lantern’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Ghostly Flame (Rare+). The lantern doesn’t require fuel, and it sheds blue-green light. It casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. You can snuff or ignite its light as a bonus action while you are within 30 feet of it.

Revealing Flame (Rare+). Creatures in the Border Ethereal within the area of the lantern’s bright light are visible to creatures on the Material Plane. When a creature within the lantern’s bright light is possessed or affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ej6wyY4G1gOcb1U6]{Magic Jar} spell, the creature in control appears overlaid on the body in a spectral form.

Mystic Sight (Very Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8]{Detect Magic} from the lantern. The spell ends early if you extinguish the light or aren’t holding the lantern.

Summon Spirit (Very Rare+). As an action, you can summon a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.qoFEjfrANBdrCP6m]{Ghost} that appears in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you. The ghost obeys your commands, and it takes its turn immediately after you on your initiative count. The ghost vanishes after 1 minute, or when it dies. You can’t use the lantern’s properties, except for Ghostly Flame, during this time.

Balefire (Legendary). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7u2obDvuvtZBkTfq]{Scorching Ray} (5th-level version, +11 to hit) from the lantern. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

Warding Light (Legendary). The lantern’s area of bright light offers the protection of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.y8A4HfTwd93ypdEz]{Magic Circle} spell. This protection can’t operate in the reverse direction, and it ends if you aren’t holding the lantern or if you’re incapacitated.

J96qUXUBKwmP7Zcf.name: Hypnovulfen Figure
J96qUXUBKwmP7Zcf.description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

This carved wooden figurine depicts a crooked wolf with large, leering eyes and a wild, toothy maw. While holding the figure, you can use it as a spellcasting focus, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs. The figure has the following properties.

Hypnovulfen Bite. Your teeth become viciously sharp. You can bite as an unarmed strike that deals [[/damage 1d6 piercing]] damage instead of bludgeoning damage.

Hypnovulfen Eye. While holding the figure, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.9hQXdMSmerkTsHDe]{Confusion} (save DC 14) with it. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Cursed Hunger. When you roll initiative, you must succeed on a DC 0 Wisdom saving throw or you can’t use your action except to use the figure’s properties until you hit a creature with a Hypnovulfen Bite attack. When you use the Hypnovulfen Eye property, the DC of this saving throw increases by 2.

Nectar of the Green Man.name: Nectar of the Green Man
Nectar of the Green Man.description:
Potion, Very Rare

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.dp6xny4v8PDoIGjh]{Commune with Nature} spell, but your experience is filled with terror and dread. You must make a [[/save WIS DC 15]] saving throw. On a failure, for the next 8 hours, you have Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks while you can see a forest. You automatically succeed on the save if you have Immunity to the Frightened condition.

This bottle is carved from wood, with a green, leafy face adorning its surface. The liquid is a deep green streaked with shades of umber.

Heightened Potency. You can learn all five facts from @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.dp6xny4v8PDoIGjh]{Commune with Nature}.

Axe of the Galloping Headsman.name: Axe of the Galloping Headsman
Axe of the Galloping Headsman.description:
Weapon (battleaxe), rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This axe has a wickedly curved head, honed to a razor’s edge and limned with dark fire. Its handle is wrapped in cracked leather, and the entirety is etched with malevolent runes.

You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by the axe’s rarity. You can also use the following properties.

Fiery Smite (Rare+). This axe deals an extra [[/damage 1d6 fire]] damage on a hit. If the target is a creature that damaged you since the end of your last turn, the extra damage becomes [[/damage 1d10]].

Mark of Guilt (Very Rare+). When you hit a creature with the axe, you can mark it for punishment (no action required). You know the direction and distance to the creature. If it leaves this plane of existence, you know the destination plane and the mark ends. The mark otherwise ends when this property is used again, or when the target dies.

Sense Guilt (Very Rare+). You can take a bonus action to hold the blade of the axe to a creature’s neck (if it has one), and it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the axe’s bonus) or you learn something the creature feels guilty about. Once this property is used, the target is immune to it for 24 hours.

Dark Binding (Legendary). Once during your turn when you hit a creature with the axe, you can immediately take a bonus action to force the target to succeed on a [[/save STR DC 19]] saving throw or be paralyzed and prone until the start of your next turn. If its body shape allows it, the target kneels and presents its neck.

Executioner’s Blade (Legendary). When you attack a prone creature using the axe, you score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the [[/r d20]]. On a critical hit, the axe deals an extra [[/damage 3d6 fire]] damage, and if the creature is left with 20 or fewer hit points after taking this damage, it must succeed on a [[/save CON DC 10]] saving throw or die.

Mark of Guilt.name: Mark of Guilt
Mark of Guilt.description: When you hit a creature with the axe, you can mark it for punishment (no action required). You know the direction and distance to the creature. If it leaves this plane of existence, you know the destination plane and the mark ends. The mark otherwise ends when this property is used again, or when the target dies.

Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood.name: Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood
Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood.description:
Staff, Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This twisted wooden staff is crowned by a trinket-adorned deer’s skull. It was fashioned by Farryn before she delved into the dark lore of Gorthos. Soft, fragrant moss and earthy mushrooms grow along the staff’s length.

While holding the staff, you can use it as a Spellcasting Focus for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the staff’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Living Ward (Rare+). You have Resistance to Necrotic damage.

Servant of the Cycle (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.uUWb1wZgtMou0TVP]{Cure Wounds} (level 3 version) from the staff. When you do so, the next time you hit with an attack before the end of your next turn, the target takes an extra [[/damage 1d10 Necrotic]] damage. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

Cycle’s Balance (Very Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.LmRHHMtplpxr9fX6]{Revivify} from the staff. When you do so, the next time a creature fails a saving throw against a spell you cast in the next hour, it and creatures of your choice within 20 feet of it take [[/damage 4d10 Necrotic]] damage. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sacrifice of Flesh (Very Rare+). When a spell you cast restores Hit Points, you can take Necrotic damage up to twice the level of the spell that can’t be reduced or prevented in any way. If you do so, the target regains additional Hit Points equal to three times the damage you take.

Death Blossom (Legendary). When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you dies, you can take a Reaction to make flowers bloom around them. Creatures of your choice within 30 feet of the dead creature regain [[/damage 4d8 healing]]{4d8 Hit Points} and gain [[/damage 2d8 temp]]. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +2.name: Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +2

Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +3.name: Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +3
Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +3

Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +2.name: Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +2

Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +1.name: Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +1

Draught of the Red Hunger.name: Draught of the Red Hunger
Draught of the Red Hunger.description:
Potion, legendary

When you drink this potion, you gain a ravenous thirst for blood and gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.UfHQhA54M4323gVO]{Vampiric Touch} spell (6th-level version, no concentration required) for 1 minute. You can repeat the attack on subsequent turns as a bonus action instead of an action.

This liquid is a shimmering red deeper and more intense than natural blood.

Heightened Potency. For the duration, as an action, you can gain the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.2IWiZAJtOGDoKjiz]{Gaseous Form} spell (no concentration required) while you aren’t in sunlight. You can also revert to your normal form as an action.

Jinxed Poker Chip.name: Jinxed Poker Chip
Jinxed Poker Chip.description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

This ceramic poker chip is painted with a crocodile’s skull on one side. Hoarse laughter sounds when it flips. While you hold the chip, it grants the following properties.

Jinxed Luck. When you fail an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can use your reaction to flip the chip. Roll [[/r 1d6]]. On a 4–6, you succeed on the ability check, attack roll, or saving throw instead. After you use this property, roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a 1–5, this property can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sense Cheating. If you have proficiency with a gaming set, you automatically succeed on ability checks to know if someone in a game you are playing is cheating.

Cursed Coin. When you roll initiative, you must succeed on a DC 0 Charisma saving throw or become cursed until you finish a short or long rest. While cursed, you subtract [[/r 1d6]] from ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. When you use the Jinxed Luck property, the saving throw DC increases by 1.

LKfTErToFGGZOOFE.name: Axe of the Galloping Headsman
LKfTErToFGGZOOFE.description:
Weapon (Battleaxe), Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This axe has a wickedly curved head, honed to a razor’s edge and limned with dark fire. Its handle is wrapped in cracked leather, and the entirety is etched with malevolent runes.

You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by the axe’s rarity. You can also use the following properties.

Sense Guilt (Very Rare+). You can take a Bonus Action to hold the blade of the axe to a creature’s neck (if it has one), and it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the axe’s bonus) or you learn something the creature feels guilty about. Once this property is used, the target is immune to it for 24 hours.

Dark Binding (Legendary). Once during your turn when you hit a creature with the axe, you can immediately take a Bonus Action to force the target to succeed on a [[/save STR DC 19]] saving throw or have the Paralyzed and Prone conditions until the start of your next turn. If its body shape allows it, the target kneels and presents its neck.

Executioner’s Blade (Legendary). When you attack a creature with the Prone condition using the axe, you score a Critical Hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20. On a Critical Hit, the axe deals an extra [[/damage 3d6 Fire]] damage, and if the creature is left with 20 or fewer Hit Points after taking this damage, it must succeed on a [[/save CON DC 10]] saving throw or die.

Mark of Guilt.name: Mark of Guilt
Mark of Guilt.description: When you hit a creature with the axe, you can mark it for punishment (no action required). You know the direction and distance to the creature. If it leaves this plane of existence, you know the destination plane and the mark ends. The mark otherwise ends when this property is used again, or when the target dies.

LpvyngYod1e8ppgj.name: Black Candle
LpvyngYod1e8ppgj.description:
Wondrous Item, Very Rare (Requires Attunement)

This broad, black tallow candle is engraved with arcane symbols. When lit, its smoke is greasy and pungent, and its flame is pale gray, but it never burns down. The candle has the following properties.

Word of Flame and Darkness. As a Bonus Action, you can light or extinguish the candle by speaking a command word while within 60 feet of it. It sheds Dim Light in a 30-foot radius.

Witchlight. While you are in the candle’s light, you can cast a level 1 or 2 spell without expending a spell slot. When you cast a spell in this way, you can't cast that spell using the candle again for 24 hours, and you must succeed on a DC 0 Constitution saving throw or take Fire damage equal to [[/roll 2d6]] times the spell's level.

Cursed Candle. After you succeed or fail on the saving throw of the Witchlight property, its save DC increases by 2. This increase can’t happen again until you finish a Long Rest. When the DC is 10 or higher, you also have Vulnerability to Necrotic damage.

Cauldron of the Vermintoll Coven.name: Cauldron of the Vermintoll Coven
Cauldron of the Vermintoll Coven.description:
Wondrous item, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

The tarnished cauldron bubbles with a strange, dark liquid. Even in transport, the liquid stays within the rune-emblazoned rim of the cauldron.

While you hold the cauldron, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your spells, you gain a bonus determined by the cauldron’s rarity to all saving throws, and you can use the following properties.

Size Change (Rare+). You can perform a 1-minute ritual to change the cauldron’s size from Tiny to Medium, or from Medium to Tiny. It weighs 1 lb. when Tiny and 80 lb. when Medium. As a Medium object, its feet can move. It has a speed of 20 feet and moves when you command it during your turn (no action required).

Cookpot (Rare+). As part of a short or long rest, you can use the Medium cauldron to prepare food for up to ten creatures. At the end of the rest, each creature that eats gains [[/damage 2d6 temp]].

Vermincall (Rare+). As an action, you can spill liquid from the cauldron to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.1Drt0SHxbEAHxprN]{Conjure Animals} with it. The conjured spirits take the form of grotesque insects or rats. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Fortifying Gorge (Very Rare+). When you use the Cookpot property, one creature of your choice who eats gains a +2 bonus to AC until you finish a short or long rest. During this time, the creature’s skin is hardened and monstrous.

Coven Abomination (Legendary). As a bonus action, you can drink from the cauldron or administer a draught from it to a creature within 5 feet. For 1 hour, the drinker of the thick, sickly-sweet liquid becomes Large if it is currently smaller than that, its reach increases by 5 feet, and its melee attacks deal an extra [[/damage 1d8]] damage. When the effect ends, the creature becomes &reference[incapacitated apply=false] for 1 minute from the agony of its bones shrinking slower than its flesh.

Shovel of Yorgrim.name: Shovel of Yorgrim
Shovel of Yorgrim.description:
Weapon (Greatclub), Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This shovel features a steel blade and collar at the end of a makeshift walking stick, appearing old and well-used. It was once the shovel of Yorgrim of the Shadestone Clan, who could commune with the spirits of the dead. It occasionally emits a faint whispering sound when handled.

You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the shovel, you can use the following properties.

Death-Kenning (Rare+). When you hit an Undead with the shovel, you can take a Bonus Action immediately after the hit to learn its Resistances, Immunities, and Vulnerabilities, if any.

Deathspeaker (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.n4JDcFKe5ikzYmAc]{Gentle Repose} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.I2LUSF5ogc7Bj62e]{Speak with Dead} from the shovel.

Deny Death’s Touch (Very Rare+). You and your allies within a 10-foot Emanation originating from you have Resistance to &reference[Necrotic apply=false] damage.

Bind Deathly Servant (Legendary). When a Humanoid dies within 30 feet of you, you can take a Reaction to turn its soul into a @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.cwvrnt9tD9YI4vQX]{Specter} that obeys your commands. If the Humanoid was Friendly to you when it died, you can turn the soul into a @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.tN4XJsdkOUnSekAc]{Wraith} instead. You can control one creature at a time with this property. The Undead disappears after 8 hours, when you create a new creature with this property, or when it dies.

Psychopomp (Legendary). As a Magic action, you and one willing creature that isn’t Undead that you touch become wraithlike until the end of your next turn. While wraithlike, you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. If you end your turn inside an object, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take [[/damage 1d10 Force]] damage. If the creature you touch is Undead, it must succeed on a [[/save CHA DC 19]] saving throw or have Vulnerability to all damage until the start of your next turn. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

OQmP5aGMlkjZLXz9.name: Shovel of Yorgrim
OQmP5aGMlkjZLXz9.description:
Weapon (greatclub), rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This shovel features a steel blade and collar at the end of a makeshift walking stick, appearing old and well-used. It was once the shovel of Yorgrim of the Shadestone Clan, who could commune with the spirits of the dead. It occasionally emits a faint whispering sound when handled.

You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the shovel, you can use the following properties.

Death-Kenning (Rare+). When you hit an Undead with the shovel, you can take a bonus action immediately after the hit to learn its resistances, immunities, and vulnerabilities, if any.

Deathspeaker (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.n4JDcFKe5ikzYmAc]{Gentle Repose} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.I2LUSF5ogc7Bj62e]{Speak with Dead} from the shovel.

Deny Death’s Touch (Very Rare+). You and your allies within 10 feet of you have resistance to &reference[necrotic apply=false] damage.

Bind Deathly Servant (Legendary). When a Humanoid dies within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to turn its soul into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.PuPo4H4Dcxigf0fY]{Specter} that obeys your commands. If the Humanoid was friendly to you when it died, you can turn the soul into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.ET4PEVEiNJLU4f7c]{Wraith} instead. You can control one creature at a time with this property. The Undead disappears after 8 hours, when you create a new creature with this property, or when it dies.

Psychopomp (Legendary). As an action, you and one willing creature that isn’t Undead that you touch become wraithlike until the end of your next turn. While wraithlike, you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If you end your turn inside an object, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take [[/damage 1d10 force]] damage. If the creature you touch is Undead, it must succeed on a [[/save CHA DC 19]] saving throw or have vulnerability to all damage until the start of your next turn. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

Tincture of Mourning.name: Tincture of Mourning
Tincture of Mourning.description:
Potion, rare

When you drink this potion, you weep with inexpressible sorrow for 1 hour. During that time, you are immune to being &reference[charmed apply=false], but your continued wailing prevents you from being silent. If you are charmed when you drink the potion, the condition is suppressed for the duration.

This glass bottle is topped with a small crypt angel carved from stone. The fluid within has the taste and consistency of tears and the colors of a rain cloud.

Heightened Potency. Creatures within 10 feet of you that are friendly to you are also immune to being charmed.

Banjo of Ol’ Jericho Sticks.name: Banjo of Ol’ Jericho Sticks
Banjo of Ol’ Jericho Sticks.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

An old, weathered banjo inscribed with runes, this instrument once belonged to Ol’ Jericho Sticks, a scarecrow bard created by a hag coven.

While holding the banjo, you can use it as a Spellcasting Focus for your spells; you gain a bonus determined by its rarity to spell attack rolls, your spell save DC, and Charisma (Performance) checks; and you can use the following properties.

Fiendish Lure (Rare+). As a Magic action, choose one Fiend or Humanoid that you can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the banjo’s bonus) or have the Charmed condition (ignoring a demon’s Immunity) for 1 minute. The Charmed condition ends if you or your allies deal damage to the target or force it to make a saving throw. Once a creature is Charmed in this way, this property can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Scarecrow’s Dance (Rare+). You can take a Bonus Action to strum the banjo and dance wildly to take the Disengage action. The music is audible within 120 feet.

Join in the Dance (Very Rare+). When you use Scarecrow’s Dance, one creature of your choice that you can see within 15 feet of you can take a Reaction to move up to half its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

Birdcage (Legendary). As a Magic action, you can force a creature you have Charmed to make a [[/save CHA DC 19]]. On a failed save, the creature disappears, drawn into the banjo. The banjo can contain one creature at a time in this way for up to 24 hours. On a success, the Charmed condition ends on the creature.

Bloody Fiddle.name: Bloody Fiddle
Bloody Fiddle.description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

This scarlet-lacquered fiddle is warm to the touch, like the heat of fresh blood. Though it looks like it has seen better days, its sound is clear and strong.

While you hold the fiddle, you gain a +2 bonus to Charisma (Performance) checks, and you can use the following properties.

Song of Stirred Blood. As an action, you can play a lively or stirring tune on the fiddle. Up to six creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you gain temporary hit points equal to [[/r 1d10 ]]+ your proficiency bonus, and if you have Bardic Inspiration dice, you can expend and roll one to add it to the total. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sanguine Curse. The first time that you play the fiddle after finishing a long rest, you take [[/damage 1 slashing]] damage that ignores resistance. When you use the Song of Stirred Blood property, this slashing damage increases by 1.

Sanguine Curse.name: Sanguine Curse
Sanguine Curse.description: Damage increases by 1 each time you use song of stirred blood.

Sight of Sin.name: Sight of Sin
Sight of Sin.description:
Potion, rare

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8]{Detect Magic} spell (no concentration required) for 10 minutes, and during that time, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to discern hidden motives or deception.

This potion is stored in a round glass flask. An iron band wraps around the bottle, ornamented with a goat’s skull.

Heightened Potency. For the duration, you also gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.DQzlB5Y3k791W5bH]{See Invisibility} spell.

Q4mXHErapKUbLGq3.name: Marotte of the Lord of Fools
Q4mXHErapKUbLGq3.description:
Rod, Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This wooden fool’s scepter is painted with vibrant, unsettling colors that depict a grinning face. While no creature is attuned to the marotte, the face looks like the infamous Chuckles, the Lord of Fools.

While holding the marotte, you can use it as a Spellcasting Focus for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the marotte’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Coulrophobia (Rare+). When you succeed on a saving throw to avoid the &reference[Frightened apply=false] condition, you can take a Reaction to force the creature that created the effect to make the same saving throw. On a failed save, it has the Frightened condition until the end of your next turn.

Fortune’s Fool (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.BQk5Row4NymMnUQl]{Hideous Laughter} (save DC = 16 + the marotte’s bonus) from the marotte. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk. You regain use of the spell early if you roll a 1 on the d20 for a D20 Test.

Fool’s Motley (Very Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7e3QXF10hLNDEdr6]{False Life} from the marotte. Any clothing or armor you wear looks like a fool’s motley for the duration of the spell.

Slapstick (Very Rare+). When a creature is affected by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.BQk5Row4NymMnUQl]{Hideous Laughter} spell you cast, you can choose another creature. When that creature deals damage to the target of the spell, the target has Disadvantage rather than Advantage on its saving throw to end the spell.

Lord of Fools (Legendary). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.5OGFdJw35QXp6mh6]{Mass Suggestion} (save DC 19) from the marotte. The effect ends on a creature if it is behind Total Cover or more than 120 feet from you. A creature affected by your Hideous Laughter automatically fails its saving throw against this Mass Suggestion. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Marotte of the Lord of Fools +2.name: Marotte of the Lord of Fools +2

Marotte of the Lord of Fools +3.name: Marotte of the Lord of Fools +3
Marotte of the Lord of Fools +3

Marotte of the Lord of Fools +2.name: Marotte of the Lord of Fools +2

Marotte of the Lord of Fools +1.name: Marotte of the Lord of Fools +1

Scythe of the Harvest Terror.name: Scythe of the Harvest Terror
Scythe of the Harvest Terror.description:
Weapon (halberd), rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This menacing scythe with a rusted blade was wielded by the Harvest Terror, a demon of secrets and fear. The scythe appears old and worn, with a handle wrapped in ancient, weathered cloth. The blade is etched with hatch marks, tallying its kills.

You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the scythe, you can use the following properties.

Feed on Fear (Rare+). Once during your turn, when you attack with the scythe and hit a frightened creature, it takes an extra [[/damage 1d10]] (legendary: [[/damage 2d10]]) psychic damage.

Sweep of Dread (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XXUDGFELgoskdOD0]{Fear} (save DC = 16 + the scythe’s bonus, no concentration required) from the scythe. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Harvest of the Hidden Word (Very Rare+). As a bonus action, you can force one &reference[frightened apply=false] creature you can see to make a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the scythe’s bonus). On a failed save, you learn one fact that it deliberately keeps secret. The creature is then immune to this property for 24 hours.

Seed of Terror (Very Rare+). Immediately after you hit a creature with the scythe, you can take a bonus action to force one creature within 30 feet of the creature you hit to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the Scythe’s bonus). On a failed save, the creature becomes frightened until the end of your next turn.

Lurking Terror (Legendary). When a frightened creature you can see ends its turn within 60 feet of you, you can use your reaction to teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space the frightened creature can see.

Harvest of the Hidden Word (Very Rare+).name: Harvest of the Hidden Word (Very Rare+)

Elixir of Fogwalking.name: Elixir of Fogwalking
Elixir of Fogwalking.description:
Potion, Rare

When you drink this potion, your breath billows out in clouds of fog. For the next 10 minutes, fog and smoke don’t hinder your vision, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.IBJmWjzbQGu7M4UX]{Fog Cloud} up to three times (no Concentration required), and you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.wqfAVANuQonNBgnL]{Misty Step} up to three times as long as your teleportation begins or ends in an area of fog.

This bottle has a base like cobblestone. The glass widens near the top before narrowing again into an iron cap, resembling a lantern. The liquid inside is a murky gray.

Heightened Potency. The potion’s duration becomes 1 hour, and when you use this potion to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.wqfAVANuQonNBgnL]{Misty Step}, you also gain Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage until the start of your next turn.

Veil of the Weeping Widow.name: Veil of the Weeping Widow
Veil of the Weeping Widow.description:
Wondrous item, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This mourning veil is imbued with alien power. The Weeping Widow wore the veil to hide her permanently tear-stained face, and rumors circulate that the widow used it to hide the otherworldly corruption writhing within her eyes.

While wearing the veil, you gain a bonus to Wisdom checks and Wisdom saving throws determined by the veil’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Psychic Fortitude (Rare+). You have resistance to &reference[psychic apply=false] damage.

Sense Grief (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er]{Detect Thoughts} (save DC = 16 + the veil’s bonus) from the veil.

Psychic Shock (Very Rare+). When a creature forces you to make a saving throw against psychic damage, or to avoid or end the &reference[charmed apply=false] or &reference[frightened apply=false] conditions, you can use your reaction to deal [[/damage 2d8 psychic]] damage to it.

Thought Worm (Very Rare+). You can use the veil to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.r3243JU4AyQJyfX4]{Modify Memory} (save DC = 16 + the veil’s bonus). When a creature fails its saving throw against the spell, you can implant a parasitic spawn of the White Worm in the target’s brain. While you’re on the same plane, you know the distance and direction to the target, and you can cast divination and enchantment spells on it as if it were in range and in sight. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WzvJ7G3cqvIubsLk]{Greater Restoration} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.qcYitWoSMTnKkzM1]{Heal} spell kills the parasite and ends this effect. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Psychic Storm (Legendary). You can take one extra reaction during a round, which you can only use to activate the Psychic Shock property.

Veiled Countenance (Legendary). When you are the target of a divination spell, the caster must succeed on a [[/save WIS DC 19]] saving throw. On a failed save, the caster takes [[/damage 6d8 psychic]] damage and becomes &reference[incapacitated apply=false] for 1 minute. At the end of each of the caster’s turns, it repeats the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

T7PUz4XIiAi3G6kB.name: Banjo of Ol’ Jericho Sticks
T7PUz4XIiAi3G6kB.description:
Wondrous item, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

An old, weathered banjo inscribed with runes, this instrument once belonged to Ol’ Jericho Sticks, a scarecrow bard created by a hag coven.

While holding the banjo, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your spells; you gain a bonus determined by its rarity to spell attack rolls, your spell save DC, and Charisma (Performance) checks; and you can use the following properties.

Fiendish Lure (Rare+). As an action, choose one Fiend or Humanoid that you can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the banjo’s bonus) or be &reference[charmed apply=false] (ignoring a demon’s immunity) for 1 minute. The charmed condition ends if you or your allies deal damage to the target or force it to make a saving throw. Once a creature is charmed in this way, this property can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Scarecrow’s Dance (Rare+). You can take a bonus action to strum the banjo and dance wildly to take the Disengage action. The music is audible within 120 feet.

Join in the Dance (Very Rare+). When you use Scarecrow’s Dance, one creature of your choice that you can see within 15 feet of you can use its reaction to move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Birdcage (Legendary). As an action, you can force a creature charmed by you to make a [[/save CHA DC 19]] saving throw. On a failure, the creature disappears, drawn into the banjo. The banjo can contain one creature at a time in this way for up to 24 hours. On a success, the charmed condition ends on the creature.

Toy Riverboat.name: Toy Riverboat
Toy Riverboat.description:
Wondrous item, very rare (requires attunement)

This tiny, brightly painted boat is made in exacting detail, with smokestacks and a paddlewheel that turns, but it looks like a child’s plaything. Studying it reveals a miniscule but unearthly passenger within the boat’s cabin. The riverboat grants the following properties.

Passengers. As an action, you and up to twelve other willing, Medium or smaller creatures you can see within 30 feet of yourself shrink to Tiny size and appear aboard the riverboat, along with up to 300 pounds of gear per passenger. The boat moves over water or other liquids at 3 miles per hour and doesn’t require wind. You can travel this way for up to 12 hours a day. A passenger that leaves the boat returns to its normal size.

Unearthly Passenger. You can release the riverboat onto water to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ImlCJQwR1VL40Qem]{Arcane Eye} with it. The riverboat is the spell’s sensor and only moves on water, but you can otherwise move it as normal for the spell.

Haunting Curse. When a creature leaves the riverboat, it must make a DC 0 Charisma saving throw, becoming cursed on a failed save. While cursed in this way, it has disadvantage on Wisdom and Charisma ability checks and on saving throws to avoid or end frightened condition. After you make this saving throw, the save DC increases by 2. This increase can’t happen again until you finish a long rest.

Revelry Suit.name: Revelry Suit
Revelry Suit.description:
Armor (hide), rare (requires attunement)

This bulky suit is made from natural materials, including fur, canvas, and straw. Its mask is exceptionally oversized and shaped into a sun, smiling in an unsettling way. While you wear this armor, you gain a +2 bonus to AC, and it grants the following properties.

Dancing Dodge. When you fail a Dexterity saving throw, if your speed isn’t 0, you can use this property to succeed instead. Once used, this property can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Wild Steps. As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Dancing Curse. When you roll initiative, you must make a DC 0 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you become incapacitated, and your speed is 0 until the start of your next turn as you perform a folk dance. When you use the Dancing Dodge or Wild Steps properties, the DC of the saving throw increases by 2. The DC of this curse can’t increase again until you finish a long rest.

UCoJWjlXQaLofLJv.name: Harvest Brew
UCoJWjlXQaLofLJv.description:
Potion, rare

When you drink this potion, you are filled with good health and bounty, providing you with enough nourishment to sustain you for 1 day. For the next hour, when you regain hit points, you regain additional hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

The potion’s bottle is made from a hollowed-out gourd, and the thick, liquid inside is a deep orange that tastes of nutmeg and cardamom.

Heightened Potency. The additional hit points you regain are equal to half your level rather than your proficiency bonus (minimum +2).

UFUlqfoO2VJwqMpZ.name: Sight of Sin
UFUlqfoO2VJwqMpZ.description:
Potion, Rare

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8]{Detect Magic} spell (no Concentration required) for 10 minutes, and during that time, you have Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to discern hidden motives or deception.

This potion is stored in a round glass flask. An iron band wraps around the bottle, ornamented with a goat’s skull.

Heightened Potency. For the duration, you also gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.DQzlB5Y3k791W5bH]{See Invisibility} spell.

UqHlvHj2hK1YQTzS.name: Tincture of Mourning
UqHlvHj2hK1YQTzS.description:
Potion, Rare

When you drink this potion, you weep with inexpressible sorrow for 1 hour. During that time, you have Immunity to the &reference[Charmed apply=false] condition, but your continued wailing prevents you from being silent. If you are Charmed when you drink the potion, the condition is suppressed for the duration.

This glass bottle is topped with a small crypt angel carved from stone. The fluid within has the taste and consistency of tears and the colors of a rain cloud.

Heightened Potency. Creatures within 10 feet of you that are Friendly to you also gain Immunity to the Charmed condition.

Tooth of the Jinxed Leviathan.name: Tooth of the Jinxed Leviathan
Tooth of the Jinxed Leviathan.description:
Weapon (Dagger), Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This tooth is razor sharp and can be wielded as a Dagger. Its “hilt” is wrapped in alligator hide, and the flat of its blade flickers with magenta hex magic in carved glyphs.

You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the tooth, you can use it as a Spellcasting Focus for your spells, and you can use the following properties.

Jinx of Dire Fortune (Rare+). As a Bonus Action, you can force one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the tooth’s bonus). On a failed save, the target is jinxed for 1 minute. While jinxed, when the target makes a D20 Test and rolls an even number on the d20, it must reroll the d20 and take the new roll. On a successful save, you must make the same saving throw, becoming jinxed for 1 minute on a failure. This property can't be used again while another creature is jinxed by it.

Exposed Weak Spot (Very Rare+). When you make an attack roll with the tooth, you score a Critical Hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.

Steal Unluck (Very Rare+). When an enemy you can see within 60 feet of you makes a D20 Test with Advantage, you can take a Reaction to negate their Advantage. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until a creature you can see makes a D20 Test and rolls a 1 on the d20, or until the next dusk.

Strange Fortunes (Legendary). Each time you score a Critical Hit with the tooth against an enemy, the tooth gains a cumulative +3 bonus to damage rolls. This bonus is in addition to the bonus based on the tooth’s rarity. When you roll a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll with the tooth, you take Force damage equal to the accumulated bonus. This property’s damage bonus returns to +0 when you finish a Long Rest.

Jinx of Dire Fortune (Rare+).name: Jinx of Dire Fortune (Rare+)
Jinx of Dire Fortune (Rare+).description: While jinxed, when the target makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw and rolls an even number on the d20, it must reroll the d20 and take the new roll. On a successful save, you must make the same saving throw, becoming jinxed for 1 minute on a failure. You can’t use this property while another creature is jinxed by it.

VOfGRXSUOMArL8aD.name: Lantern of the Chained Reaper
VOfGRXSUOMArL8aD.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This ornate Hooded Lantern was once a weapon in the hands of the Chained Reaper, filled with ghastly balefire. Able to pierce the veil, the lantern reveals a glimpse at things hidden from mortal eyes.

While you hold the lantern and it is lit, you gain a bonus to Intelligence (Investigation) and Wisdom (Perception) checks determined by the lantern’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Ghostly Flame (Rare+). The lantern doesn’t require fuel, and it sheds blue-green light. It casts Bright Light in a 30-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 30 feet. You can snuff or ignite its light as a Bonus Action while you are within 30 feet of it.
