Touch of Oblivion (Rare+).name: Touch of Oblivion (Rare+)
Touch of Oblivion (Rare+).description: As a bonus action, you can touch a creature that has been dead for less than 1 hour. It rots away to bleached bone and can’t be used for this property again. The next time you hit with an unarmed strike using the Rotting Touch property before the end of your next turn, it is a critical hit instead.

y4r4yyLnG2fEwZGy.name: Mask of Lethica Nightborne
y4r4yyLnG2fEwZGy.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This immaculate porcelain mask is painted with delicate violet filigree and once belonged to Lethica Nightborne—a priestess of a goddess of night and healing known as the Nightmother.

While wearing the mask, you gain a bonus to Wisdom and Charisma saving throws determined by the mask’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Gift of the Night Goddess (Rare+). You can see normally in magical and nonmagical Dim Light and Darkness.

Soothing Darkness (Rare+). Creatures of your choice in the area of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq]{Darkness} spell that you cast have Resistance to Psychic damage.

Whispers of Night (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq]{Darkness} from the mask. This property can be used twice (Very Rare+: four times), regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

Balm of Midnight (Very Rare+). At the start of your turn, a Frightened creature of your choice within 60 feet of you must make a [[/save WIS DC 15]] saving throw. On a success, the condition ends, and if the creature is in an area of Darkness, it gains [[/damage 2d10 temp]].

Offering of Burdens (Legendary). As a Magic action, you can touch a willing creature with &reference[Exhaustion apply=false] levels and transfer any number of Exhaustion levels to yourself, then remove up to two Exhaustion levels from yourself and regain one expended spell slot of level 5 or lower. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Surcease of Sorrows (Legendary). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.r3243JU4AyQJyfX4]{Modify Memory} from the mask (save DC 19). If the target voluntarily fails the saving throw, you can choose a memory that happened at any time in its lifespan. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Soothing Darkness (Rare+).name: Soothing Darkness (Rare+)
Soothing Darkness (Rare+).description: Creatures of your choice in the area of a Darkness spell that you cast have resistance to Psychic damage.

yoxPUtasaqHQgPV8.name: Lilypad Tonic
yoxPUtasaqHQgPV8.description:
Potion, Common

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.04nMsTWkIFvkbXlY]{Polymorph} spell (no Concentration required), turning you into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.EZgiprHXA2D7Uyb3]{Frog}.

This potion is found in a clay jar shaped and painted like a large frog, with a cork stopper in its back.

Heightened Potency. The potion has six doses instead of one.

zhJuQ6LwVCDILePE.name: Amber Birdcage
zhJuQ6LwVCDILePE.description:
Wondrous Item, Very Rare (Requires Attunement)

This birdcage, shaped from amber, physically replaces your torso while you are attuned to it. When your Attunement ends, it separates from you, and your torso returns to its previous state. The birdcage has the following properties.

Sense Fiends. As a Bonus Action, you can sense the location of Fiends or magical effects created by Fiends within 60 feet of yourself.

Capture Fiend. As a Magic action, choose one Bloodied Fiend that you can see within 60 feet of yourself. It must succeed on a [[/save CHA DC 15]] saving throw or be transformed into an amber songbird and trapped in the birdcage. The songbird is an inert object until removed from the cage and released. You can remove one songbird from the cage as a Bonus Action. If you stop holding the bird, the Fiend reverts to its true form with all its Hit Points, and it is Hostile to you.

Consume Songbird. As a Magic action, you can consume one amber songbird you are holding. The Fiend dies, and you can either regain one expended spell slot with a level up to half the Fiend’s CR, or you can gain Temporary Hit Points equal to the Fiend’s CR.

Amber Curse. You have a −1 penalty to Wisdom saving throws. Each time you use the Capture Fiend or Consume Songbird properties, this penalty increases by 1.

zhOwUYwxjOA5BdsP.name: Midwife Shears
zhOwUYwxjOA5BdsP.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

These scissors are shaped to resemble a stork. Their blades are forever wickedly sharp, and the threads they cut are more than merely physical.

Cut the Unseen Thread. While holding the scissors, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8]{Dispel Magic} (+4 bonus) or Remove Curse from them. Once either spell is cast from the scissors, that spell can’t be cast from them again until the next dusk.

Curse of the Severed Thread. When you make a saving throw to avoid being pushed or to avoid the &reference[Prone apply=false] condition, you have a −1 penalty to the roll. This penalty increases by 1 each time you use the Cut the Unseen Thread property. If you fail such a save by 5 or more, you are pushed 1d6 x 5 feet straight away from the source of the save, in addition to any other distance pushed.

Cut the Unseen Thread - Dispel Magic.name: Cut the Unseen Thread - Dispel Magic

Cut the Unseen Thread - Remove Curse.name: Cut the Unseen Thread - Remove Curse
